titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Peter Cain and William Walker, Indictment
CWG7260

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Washington Circuit Court
Peter Cain & William Walker

the Grand Jury of Washington County in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Peter Cain & William Walker of the crime of Robbery commited as follows the Said Peter Cain & William Walker on the 1st day of March 1865 in the county aforesaid did feloniously Steal take and carry away one Silver watch of the value of Twenty dollars and Some treasury notes of the United States the number of notes and destination of Each note is unknown to the Grand jury but in all representing thre dollars and of value of three dollars the personal property goods and chattels of John W. Anderson Indsor from his person & in his pressence against his will and by force and putting Said Indsor in fear of Some imimediate injury to his person against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses before the Jury
John W. Indsor
Stephen Indsor
L, H, Noble atty for com'th

Copy attest
J, P, Barbour clk

Comnmonwealth
Indict
Robbery
Cain & Walker
a true bill
D. M. McIlvoy
Foreman of the Grand Jury
$3,00 for Cain
$5,00 for Walker
Filed Oct 17th 1865
J. P. Barbour clk
Bench Warrant issued for Walker Nov 21 1865.
